page.title: 18COWLING HILL
page.content: The name Cowling suggests a Saxon settlement. Around 560 AD a family named'Coll' settled in the area and 'inge' means home hence the name Collinge as Cowling used to be known. During the Norman time land was given to the Emmott brothers as a reward for their services to William the Conqueror.A settlement developed with Cowling Hill as its centre. There was little arable land in 1086 due to high,uncleared land. Reclamation took place in the 16th century.Farms were built between 1280 and 1580. Cowling Hill's importance is illustrated by the Chapel as a number of roads converge here. The present Carr Head Hall is not the original building but was built in 1851.The estate covers about 56 acres.
